Side Effects: severe urine retention and constipation causing extreme discomfort.
Comments: helped my breathing but not worth the side effects

Side Effects: Gained 7 lbs in 3 weeks_ feel very bloated.  Appetite did not increase nor did caloric intake.
Comments: Stopping the med_ side effect not worth it

Reason: COPD from bad lungs blood clots
Side Effects: Pain in elbows_ arms_ legs.weakness in body. Upper respiratory issues. Eyes have become blurry_ confusion_ have the shakes. Told my doctor finally there are too many issues..feel allergic..wasnt aware of spiriva effects. I was just given regular steroids instead..i can breathe and not have all the issues. Dangerous stuff!!!.
None so far
Extreme weight gain around the middle
Did nothing for shortness of breath.
I think most of my side effects are from Symbicort but weight gain_ heart burn_ headache_ Urinary issues at times...
Comments: Spiriva seems like it helps a lot. Most side effects I noticed happened after adding Symbicort to my Spiriva. Spiriva has helped me a lot and the couple of times I missed my dose my lungs sure reminded me.

Side Effects: Weight Gain_ I get irritated very easy

Reason: COPD_ on O2 and use othere inhalers
Side Effects: Can't diagnose _ but I can say that since I've been on Spiriva my eyes are getting very  blurry_   (use to get blurry only when I needed to use my inhaler)_  have gained terrible belly weight_ my normal daily bowel habits are now every other day with constipation and gas_ I was hospitalized for a blocked small intestine_ my breathing hasn't improved much and my sleeping is now intermittent.
Comments: I've wondered why so many things have changed all at one time - I was doing well and becoming more active.Now I've lost all I've gained and feel unwell.  Never would have guessed till I read so many similar complaints by others with equal  changes and symptoms.

Reason: Recommended by a doctor for COPD
Side Effects: The first symptoms were severe lower back pain_ along with dry mouth and eyes. The back pain became so severe that I started feeling nauseated_ along with dizzy spells and blurred vision. Then I experienced daily abdominal pains due to constipation. At first I didn't associate it with the medication_ but after three weeks the constipation got out of control. The pain became so severe that I finally passed out in the bathroom. The bowel movement was anything but normal; first hard_ then diarhea_ and finally blood - all symptoms of an intestinal blockage. It's been two weeks now since I've taken Spiriva_ and all the above symptoms have disappeared.
Comments: I would strongly advise against taking this drug! Make sure you read about the list of side affects_ which is a mile long. It mentions constipation_ but it does not warn that it may cause an intestinal blockage.

Side Effects: So far no adverse side affects. And a huge improvement in breathing. I am a Vietnam Vet. With a heart transplant diagnosis to deal with since 2008. Also COPD being for many years a smoker. Anyway being 100 pct disabled and housebound. But with all the sad things in the news about VA healthcare. They as a whole have saved my life. Over the past 6 yrs saved my life. Have a fantastic caring primary care doctor. And converse with him and his staff mostly on a site called my health vet. And my responce time is rapid. So in reference to the COPD. He gave me Spirava and yes very new to useing it. But can breath better than I have in years. So god bless the VA and the care for a heart that barely works. 3 heart surgeries in 5 years. So needless to say one of the side affects is heart pain. I welcome it_ compared to all I've experienced since 08. And so far can breath much much better. Thanks for all the health help I've gotten from the great health care employees at the VA with a endless job in front of them. Good luck to those who may read this.        Thanks
severe dry mouth weight gain around middle red eyes and irritation trouble with passing urine and extreme irratation
Comments: has not helped with my breathing

Side Effects: cleared up my mucous problem.
Comments: caused extremely dry mouth and sinusitis so I have to breathe through my mouth.  Now I'm addicted to nose spray.  Will try to get off it on my next visit.

Side Effects: stabbing pain in head_started in just like the sinus's now it's like having   5 knifes being jammed into my skull gets worse each time helped the lungs but have to stop because of the pain
weight gain around the mid section only. I'm very active fit person. It has slightly decreased how often I have to use my fast acting inhaler.
disabling back muscle spasms. Muscle relaxants and pain killers had no effect. tried acupuncture_ massage_ chiropractic. Stopped completely after stopping the drug!

Backpain_ thirst.  Occasional leg pain (sharp stabbing pain coming from nowhere...goes away in as little as 10 seconds_ sometimes 20-30 minutes.)  Use heating pad for backache_ and drink a lot of water for the thirst. Livable side effects_ IMO.
Comments: Taking Spiriva in conjunction with Daliresp...astounding improvement: went from 88 on resting blood oxygen level to just about normal (reading of 94)  Even on mild exertion_ it only fell to 89. I can walk for 10 minutes without getting short of breath.  I can actually talk a little while walking!  I go about normal household tasks without taking a break every 5 minutes.   I don't wake up short of breath in middle of the night. Yes_ there's a few side effects_ but so far I can deal with those just fine.  I am dieting_ and have lost weight without difficulty so not getting the weight gain issues at all.  Have COPD...quit smoking 8 years ago but apparently I inherited bad lungs so got the COPD even though I quit  (and have never worked in a chemical-type industry or town either.)

Side Effects: The usual dry eyes_ thirst_ etc._ after being on it for 3years developed neuropathy symptoms_ was  Dxed with Small Fiber Neuropathy but painful symptoms turned out to be caused mostly by the medication... still on it but not taking as much and have far less pain.
Comments: They call this side effect 'paresthesias' in drug info_ it can be a lot more  severe than that implies.

Side Effects: Dry mouth to the point it was painful. Disturbed sleep_belly weight gain and bloat. Increased heart rate.  Not sure exactly what it did do for my lungs.
Comments: I've only stopped this 2-3 days and already feel better

Side Effects: This medicine worked for many months_ however the dry mouth has gotten intolerable.  I won't take the medicine any more.

I had taken Spiriva for 6 months. My eyes became Severely red and burning . My eyes looked like a birght red sun going down . Severe pain in my eyes. Stopped taking it 6 months ago and my eyes are still very painful.
Comments: I would never ever take this drug again....it didn't help my breathing and was not worth the side effects it left me with.

Side Effects: Tried it on two separate occasions. Got a chronic-type bronchitis within 5 days of starting this drug_ each time.Bronchitis disappeared within 5 days_ once I stopped taking it_ each time.
Extreme mid-section weight gain and bloat.  In three months I'd gained 22lbs and 4 inches on my mid-section...and no place else!
Comments: Although it's been six months since I last used the inhaler the weight gain_ and bloating_ has not subsided.  I've had an ultrasound done which showed no blockage.  Tomorrow morning I will undergo a colonoscopy to see if anything can be found.  I'm not the only person that this has happened to. There are more on the internet.

Side Effects: No side effects.
Comments: I was put on spirva for my asthma_ so I could sleep through the night without waking up to take a hit off my asthma inhaler. Since I have been on Spiriva I have not had to use my rescue inhaler at all. It works great for me.

Side Effects: none
